alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:33PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Orange, east central Addison, and southwestern Washington Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 333 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lincoln, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montpelier, Northfield Village, Warren, Ripton, Northfield, Lincoln, Waitsfield, Berlin, Roxbury, Williamstown, E F Knapp State Airport, Bristol, Moretown, Granville, Barre City, Barre Town, Fayston, Washington, Brookfield, and Middlesex. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 40 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
